oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-12-23 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 23, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers, and the Delmore Brothers (Alton and Rabon). Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; George Wilkerson; Fruit Jar Drinkers; Delmore Brothers; Uncle Dave Macon
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: The Great Speckled Bird (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) [continued from part 1] -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers -- Boil Them Cabbage Down (George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers) -- George D. Hay introduces the Delmore Brothers -- What Would You Give In Exchange For Your Soul (Delmore Brothers) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Be All Smiles Tonight (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon -- Something's Always Sure To Tickle Me (Uncle Dave Macon) -- George D. Hay introduces the Delmore Brothers -- Weary Lonesome Blues (Delmore Brothers) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- Closing theme (Give The Fiddler A Dram) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (David Stone)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Wilkerson, George W., 1895-1954; Fruit Jar Drinkers (Musical group); Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Macon, Dorris; Delmore Brothers; Delmore, Alton; Delmore, Rabon, 1916-1952
